question: The Reserve Bank of India recently amended its Know Your Customer (KYC) norms to allow which type of authentication?
explanation:
The Reserve Bank of India recently allowed video-based authentication as an alternative method to the e-KYC (Know-your-customer) norms. The video-based KYC authentication was proposed by the Expert Committee on Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, headed by the former SEBI Chairman UK Sinha.
The Reserve Bank accepted the recommendations and amended its KYC norms to include Video based Customer Identification Process (V-CIP). The bank also announced that the video verification will be Aadhar-based and the user can display his documents via a video chat.
